      • WordGrid

        public WordGrid(int rows,
        int cols)
        Initialize the grid to the size specified and fill all of the positions with spaces.
        Parameters:
        rows - is the starting height of the WordGrid
        cols - is the starting width of the WordGrid

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        The proper formatting for a WordGrid is created in the toString.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String with each character separated by spaces, and each row separated by newlines.

      • max

        public static int max(int[][] ary)
        Finds the maximum number in the array, assuming that the input array is made up of integers.
        Parameters:
        ary - is the given array you want to find the max number of.
        Returns:
        the maximum number OR 0 if array has length of 0 (array is null)

      • rowSum

        public static int rowSum(int[][] ary,
         int x)
        Finds the sum of the elements of a specified row in a given array. Assumes that the inputed row parameter is within the array.
        Parameters:
        ary - is the array in which you want the sum of one of its rows.
        x - is the row whose elements you want the sum of.
        Returns:
        the sum of the row you specify OR 0 if the array has a length of 0 (array is null)

      • isSquare

        public static boolean isSquare(int[][] ary)
        Checks if the array is square (i.e. every row has the same length as AR itself).
        Parameters:
        ary - is the array you want to check the squarity of.
        Returns:
        true if the number of rows= number of columns; false otherwise.

      • allRowSums

        public static int[] allRowSums(int[][] AR)
        Calculates the row sum for every row and returns each of the values in an array. Index i of the return array contains the sum of elements in row i.
        Parameters:
        AR - is the array in which you want the sum of one of its rows.
        Returns:
        memory of new array with sums (use Arrays.toString(allRowSums(some array)) to return the row sum for every row with index i of the return array = the sum of elements in row i.)

      • columnSum

        public static int columnSum(int[][] AR,
            int x)
        Finds the sum of the elements of a specified column in a given array. Assumes that the inputed column parameter is within the array.
        Parameters:
        AR - is the array in which you want the sum of one of its columns.
        x - is the column whose elements you want the sum of.
        Returns:
        the sum of the elements in Column x of AR OR 0 if the array has a length of 0 (array is null)

      • isRowMagic

        public static boolean isRowMagic(int[][] AR)
        Checks if the array is row-magic (if every row has the same row sum);
        Parameters:
        AR - is the array which you're checking for row-magic.
        Returns:
        true if the array is row-magic or has length 0 and false otherwise.

      • isColumnMagic

        public static boolean isColumnMagic(int[][] AR)
        Checks if the array is column-magic (this means that every column has the same column sum) Note: Rows can have different lengths
        Parameters:
        AR - is the array which you're checking for column-magic.
        Returns:
        true if the array is column-magic or has length 0 and false otherwise.

      • checkWord

        public boolean checkWord(java.lang.String word,
                int row,
                int col,
                int dx,
                int dy)
        Checks if the word fits in the given row, column, and direction AND does not overlap
        Parameters:
        word - is any text to be added to the word grid
        row - is the row you want the word to start in
        col - is the column you want the word to start in
        dx - +1 (or just 1) is to the right, -1 is to the left, 0 means no x coordinate
        dy - +1 (or just 1) is down, -1 is up, 0 means no y coordinate
        Returns:
        true when the word fits, the direction exists, and there is no overlap when the word is added; false otherwise

      • checkOverlap

        public boolean checkOverlap(java.lang.String letter,
                   int row,
                   int col)
        Checks if there is overlap, that is, if the letter at a given spot is different from the letter wordgrid is about to put in
        Parameters:
        letter - is what you're going to put in and are checking to see if it's different from what's there
        row - is the row the letter is in
        col - is the column the letter is in
        Returns:
        true when there is an overlap, false otherwise

      • addWord

        public boolean addWord(java.lang.String word,
              int row,
              int col,
              int dx,
              int dy)
        Adds a word to the WordGrid
        dx dy Direction
        0 -1 N
        -1 -1 NW
        -1 0 W
        -1 1 SW
        0 1 S
        1 1 SE
        1 0 E
        1 -1 NE
        Parameters:
        word - is any text to be added to the word grid
        row - is the row you want the word to start in
        col - is the column you want the word to start in
        dx - +1 (or just 1) is to the right, -1 is to the left, 0 means no x coordinate
        dy - +1 (or just 1) is down, -1 is up, 0 means no y coordinate
        Returns:
        true when the word fits, the direction exists, and there is no overlap when the word is added; false otherwise

        Adds words randomly from a given list of words Number of words added is based on size of array
        Parameters:
        allWords - the dictionary/word list the words are from

      • wordsInPuzzle

        public java.lang.String wordsInPuzzle()
        Tells you the words used in the WordGrid
        Returns:
        a formatted string of text that has several words per line

      • loadWordsFromFile

        public void loadWordsFromFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                     boolean fillRandomLetters)
        Loads word from a file and fills in empty spaces in wordGrid if asked to
        Parameters:
        fileName - tells WordGrid from which file to read all of the words
        fillRandomLetters - determines if you need to fill it up or not
